DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of mastoid bone autograft for dorsal nasal augmentation in rhinoplasty.
DOC.brief_title: Mastoid Bone Autograft for Dorsal Nasal Augmentation
DOC.detailed_description: INTRODUCTION: Several grafts and/or implants have been used for dorsal augmentation. In some cases, especially the traumatic, non-caucasian, and multi-operated ones, the amount of augmentation is higher than the usually available from septal and auricular conchal autografts. OBJECTIVE: To evaluate the safety and efficacy of mastoid bone autograft for dorsal nasal augmentation in rhinoplasty. DESIGN: A prospective study of 15 consecutive patients submitted to dorsal nasal augmentation with mastoid bone, during a 2-year period. SETTING: One major academic medical center.
DOC.criteria: Nasal acquired or congenital deformity of the dorsum that requires augmentation of more than 5 mm Previous otologic surgery/disease
